website_summaries.verdict: You should consider this attractive option when you get really serious about taking your gazebo to the next level.
pros: Durable construction that features a rustproof finish and a UV-treated polycarbonate roof
cons: Assembly can be very difficult if you do it yourself, involving at least a couple of people and a couple of days
one big complaint is that water comes in through the bottom of the body panels

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The roof fell apart. I didn’t even have it for a year. I paid for the installation through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Love the gazebo
customer_reviews.text: I love it and the other folks who bought it have been helpful with questions I've had. I'm still trying to keep out the last bit of rain that comes in through the floor. Otherwise, I really enjoy sitting out there. I put down Ikea snap together wood floor tiles and a portable a/c unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent excellent excellent. Very well made. It took 3 guys plus 1 for 1/2 day to get it done by following the instructions. We feel it is the best purchase we have made v in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product is beautiful, but I was surprised that the windows are made of film and not poly-carbonite sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Meissner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a hot tub
customer_reviews.text: We bought this a few months ago as a shelter for our hot tub. It exceeded our expectations! Now that the temperatures are below freezing, we noticed that the inside temperature is at least 15 degrees warmer than the outside temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Windows are just a film not Plexiglas ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Windows are just a film not Plexiglas but the performance has been very good. Using it on a daily basis and have not complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the best thing i purchased so many compliments , that i have the best gazebo they ever seen
customer_reviews.author: Allen Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Honest review
customer_reviews.text: Setting it up took only about 10 hours. It looks beautiful on our back yard and is exactly what we wanted. The only thing is that it was sealed form water better at the bottom. I had to put clear silicon on the bottom to prevent water from coming in. Other than that great product
customer_reviews.author: Erik Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. Took 8 hrs to build. It comes in 4 separate boxes.. Year around usage.
customer_reviews.author: seeker1026

customer_reviews.title: not easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Final product is what was expected. Least, not easy to assemble. Could of used simple setup fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H

customer_reviews.title: I have my Jacuzzi in it and there is still ...
customer_reviews.text: I have my Jacuzzi in it and there is still room for table and chairs. It protects us from the elements.
customer_reviews.author: SHERRY DECKER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: except for some minor adjustments, i was able to do it myself without anybody's help in 2 days
customer_reviews.author: Jose isorena

customer_reviews.title: Gazebo Penguin 12x18
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Came damaged in shipping and company replaced everything we asked for. I did manage to assemble it all by myself, but it wasn't easy. Some of the screws stripped out, but there were plenty of them. Except for the long ones top side of door track. Had to find 2 more nuts (metric). It took me more than a week to build it, working only after my regular work.
customer_reviews.author: bourboncask

customer_reviews.title: overall we like it only thing bad is in the winter it ...
customer_reviews.text: took me and my husband 2 days to assemble. overall we like it only thing bad is in the winter it lets rain slide through the screen into the a reservoir at the bottom of the panel and it floods the inside and gets any rugs or things we have wet. Have to put towels along edges. also not so sure about the solar rating on the roof. rugs and colored items have severe fading from the sun getting through.
customer_reviews.author: vintagegirl1975

customer_reviews.title: Gazebo is very nice once is put together instructions are not very clear ...
customer_reviews.text: Gazebo is very nice once is put together instructions are not very clear at all they could mark pieces with and aero showing top and bottom for pieces and the plastic protecting the windows on the doors is next to impossible to take off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: polycarbonate roof does not last
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Sojar Gazebo from Costco with polycarbonate roof. It did not last long under California Weather. Panels started peeling off with bubbles and broken off after 3rd year in use. I called them up but there is no warranty or replacement. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Building is nice for the price we have our hot tub
customer_reviews.text: Building is nice for the price we have our hot tub, table and TV . Instructions are not the greatest definitely recommend four people for the construction and two tall ladders for the main beam install. Used 5/8 calk backer to fill gap between wall and roof to keep out cold weather and bugs. Put indoor/outdoor carpeting from Menards. We spend a lot of time out there. A great investment to make a patio a nice useable space. The door install was difficult due to the poor instructions
customer_reviews.author: Rich Goudie

product_meta.title: Gazebo Penguin Florence Solarium 12 Ft. x 15 Ft. in Sand
product_meta.description: Size:12' x 15'| Color:SandExtend the enjoyment of your outdoor space with our solarium. This unit can be left up year round, saving yourself the trouble of assembling and disassembling at the end of the season. The solarium is constructed of aluminum and features a reinforced polycarbonate roof, two sliding doors and 5-position wind panels. This unit has been carefully designed to withstand exposure to rain, snow and harsh UV rays. This item is not insulated but you can still enjoy the extra lounge space to accommodate friends and family during various social festivities and relaxing spa days.
feature_bullets: Powder-coated aluminum structure with polycarbonate roof, reinforced roof is made from 0.3125-in polycarbonate material in smoke color, door handles are able to be reinstalled and allow you to decide whether you would prefer having the door open to the left or to the right
The wind panels can slide all the way down to the bottom or in any of the 5 positions of the solarium and allow maximum air circulation
Caps are included to hide all unsightly screws

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars34 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
